attributes.action: Protect the privacy of people using on-line networking sites from unfair exploitation
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In the current climate of concern about the security of personal and private information it should be a legal requirement that any web site offering services to UK citizens must be an opt-in service. Users must explicitly opt-in to permit personal or private information to be shared between different web sites. An example of the wrong way is Facebook's "Beacon" application which shares information about users without their explicit consent, they are instead offered fleeting and not necessarily obvious opportunities to opt-out.

The Data Protection Act should be updated to reflect this abuse of personal and private information.
